1.text: Howbeit, Job, I pray thee, hear my speech, and hearken to all my words.

2.text: Behold now, I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

3.text: My words shall utter the uprightness of my heart: and that which my lips know they shall speak sincerely.

4.text: The spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty giveth me life.

5.text: If thou canst, answer thou me; set thy words in order before me, stand forth.

6.text: Behold, I am toward God even as thou art: I also am formed out of the clay.

7.text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my pressure be heavy upon thee.

8.text: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

9.text: I am clean, without transgression; I am innocent, neither is there iniquity in me:

10.text: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy;

11.text: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

12.text: Behold, I will answer thee, in this thou art not just; for God is greater than man.

13.text: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

14.text: For God speaketh once, yea twice, though man regardeth it not.

15.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

16.text: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

17.text: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man;

18.text: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

19.text: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and with continual strife in his bones:

20.text: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

21.text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

22.text: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the pit, and his life to the destroyers.

23.text: If there be with him an angel, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man what is right for him;

24.text: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit, I have found a ransom.

25.text: His flesh shall be fresher than a childâ€™s; he returneth to the days of his youth:

26.text: He prayeth unto God, and he is favourable unto him; so that he seeth his face with joy: and he restoreth unto man his righteousness.

27.text: He singeth before men, and saith, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not:

28.text: He hath redeemed my soul from going into the pit, and my life shall behold the light.

29.text: Lo, all these things doth God work, twice, yea thrice, with a man,

30.text: To bring back his soul from the pit, that he may be enlightened with the light of the living.

31.text: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

32.text: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

33.text: If not, hearken thou unto me: hold thy peace, and I will teach thee wisdom.
